_header: Loss of goods grieveth me sore
_description: Time lost is never recovered — four lines

Bod840.Transcription:
Losse of goodes me ruefes sorebut losse of dayes is much more re
                    storing of goodes is often senebut losse of dayes comes neuer
                    agayne

OxfBal316B.Transcription:
Los of goodes greveth me full sorbut loss of good grevethe me mase
                    morRecovery of goodes es often tymes synand soo es the tyme never
                    Recovered aȝen
OxfBal316B.Note:
Added to right margin by a later hand of the fifteenth or sixteenth
                    century.
OxfBal316B.Editions:
Mynors,  Roger Aubrey Baskerville,
                        ed.  
             Catalogue of Manuscripts in Balliol College Library.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1962: 334.

BLCottTitAXXVI.Transcription:
Losse of good men Rewe forBut losse of tyme is moche
                    moreRecouery of godys is often seyneBut lose of tyme Comys neuyr A
                    gayne

TCD159.Transcription:
Losse [cropped, bottom of page]but losse tym grreves me moreffor
                    lose of goodes thy wyll restorebut Lose of tym comethe no more
TCD159.Note:
Added by a sixteenth-century hand, upside-down in lower
                    margin.
